But there were too many in that age valiant for the truth, for adherence to which the Church had undergone ten persecutions; and such a resistance was made by those who knew the truth as it isin Jesus, to an er- ror so awful as the denial of the supreme and co-eternal Godhead of Christ, that a Council was speedily convened—thefirstgeneral Council of the Chris- tian Church, viz. that of Nice; at which 318 Bishops, from all parts where Christianity had been established, were assembled, with numerous Presbyters and others, to the number, it is said, ofabove 2000 persons.
